summary: The document is a memorandum from 13 April 1972, detailing the establishment of a P.O. Box in Washington, D.C., under the alias 'Biego S. Mardones' for the purpose of receiving materials by an officer named Mr. Gilbert Richmond. It references a telephonic request for this arrangement and acknowledges the cooperation involved. This memorandum is part of the records associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: Establishment of a P.O. Box under an alias for confidential communications.
Involvement of an officer, Mr. Gilbert Richmond, in receiving materials through this P.O. Box.
The document is part of records related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
keywords: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
